title: Best Motorola Moto G (2025) power banks
description: Charge your Motorola Moto G (2025) anytime with these power banks. The post Best Motorola Moto G (2025) power banks appeared first on Phandroid.
author: Ajit Singh
excerpt: Charge your Motorola Moto G (2025) anytime with these power banks.
text: The Motorola Moto G (2025) is the newest Moto G series smartphone. It sports a 6.7-inch IPS LCD display with 120Hz refresh rate. There is the MediaTek Dimensity 6300 processor with 4GB of RAM and 64GB/128GB storage options. The smartphone has a 5,000mAh battery with 50W wired fast charging. It will help you charge the phone at a much quicker pace. However, it may not always be possible to charge the phone using a fast charger. This is where a portable charger aka power bank can help you out. Here are the best Motorola Moto G (2025) power banks you can get. Sale Anker PowerCore 24,000mAh Power Bank This is a 24,000mAh power bank featuring dual USB-C ports and a USB-A port. One of the USB-C ports is also meant for recharging the power bank. It can deliver a maximum output of 140W. Its smart digital display shows battery percentage, time to recharge, and output through each port. Sale Baseus 20,000mAh Power Bank This power bank features 20,000mAh capacity and a total of four ports. It has a USB-C input/output port (65W), a microUSB input port (18W), and dual USB output ports (30W). Its display shows the remaining battery, charging voltage, and charging current. Available in Black and Blue color options. Sale UGREEN 25,000mAh Power Bank This is a 25,000mAh capacity power bank from UGREEN. It has dual USB-C ports (45W and 100W) and a USB-A port (18W). It has an LED display that shows the current battery level. It supports USB PD 3.0 fast charging technology. Baseus 30,000mAh Portable Charger This is a massive 30,000mAh power bank that needs to recharge only once and will last for days. It has dual USB-A ports and a USB-C port which can also be used for input with a peak output of 22.5W. It has a microUSB input port as well. Display shows current battery percentage and an icon if the connected device supports fast charging. Sale Miady 10,000mAh Power Bank (2-pack) You get two 10,000mAh power banks with this bundle. It has two USB ports and a USB Type-C port. It is quite compact and lightweight which makes it convenient to carry. It comes with a USB cable but no lightning cable. Choose from six color combinations. Anker PowerCore Slim 10,000mAh Power Bank This is a slim power bank with just 0.6-inch thickness. It has a USB-C port that can deliver up to 20W fast charging and a USB-A port that can go up to 12W. You can charge two devices together. The package comes with a USB-A to USB-A and a USB-A to USB-C cable. Available in Black, White, Blue, and Green colors. Sale INIU 10,000mAh Power Bank This is the power bank to get if you are looking for a slim and affordable product. It has a 10,000mAh capacity and a single USB-C port supporting input and output. The only thing to note is its maximum charging speed is 15W. Available in five different colors. He started his stint in tech journalism in 2015 and has previously worked with publications like Digit India and Android Headlines. You can also find his work on MySmartPrice. html:
The Motorola Moto G (2025) is the newest Moto G series smartphone. It sports a 6.7-inch IPS LCD display with 120Hz refresh rate. There is the MediaTek Dimensity 6300 processor with 4GB of RAM and 64GB/128GB storage options.

The smartphone has a 5,000mAh battery with 50W wired fast charging. It will help you charge the phone at a much quicker pace. However, it may not always be possible to charge the phone using a fast charger. This is where a portable charger aka power bank can help you out. Here are the best Motorola Moto G (2025) power banks you can get.

Sale

Anker PowerCore 24,000mAh Power Bank

This is a 24,000mAh power bank featuring dual USB-C ports and a USB-A port. One of the USB-C ports is also meant for recharging the power bank. It can deliver a maximum output of 140W. Its smart digital display shows battery percentage, time to recharge, and output through each port.

Sale

Baseus 20,000mAh Power Bank

This power bank features 20,000mAh capacity and a total of four ports. It has a USB-C input/output port (65W), a microUSB input port (18W), and dual USB output ports (30W). Its display shows the remaining battery, charging voltage, and charging current. Available in Black and Blue color options.

Sale

UGREEN 25,000mAh Power Bank

This is a 25,000mAh capacity power bank from UGREEN. It has dual USB-C ports (45W and 100W) and a USB-A port (18W). It has an LED display that shows the current battery level. It supports USB PD 3.0 fast charging technology.

Baseus 30,000mAh Portable Charger

This is a massive 30,000mAh power bank that needs to recharge only once and will last for days. It has dual USB-A ports and a USB-C port which can also be used for input with a peak output of 22.5W. It has a microUSB input port as well. Display shows current battery percentage and an icon if the connected device supports fast charging.

Sale

Miady 10,000mAh Power Bank (2-pack)

You get two 10,000mAh power banks with this bundle. It has two USB ports and a USB Type-C port. It is quite compact and lightweight which makes it convenient to carry. It comes with a USB cable but no lightning cable. Choose from six color combinations.

Anker PowerCore Slim 10,000mAh Power Bank

This is a slim power bank with just 0.6-inch thickness. It has a USB-C port that can deliver up to 20W fast charging and a USB-A port that can go up to 12W. You can charge two devices together. The package comes with a USB-A to USB-A and a USB-A to USB-C cable. Available in Black, White, Blue, and Green colors.

Sale

INIU 10,000mAh Power Bank

This is the power bank to get if you are looking for a slim and affordable product. It has a 10,000mAh capacity and a single USB-C port supporting input and output. The only thing to note is its maximum charging speed is 15W. Available in five different colors.

Note: This article may contain affiliate links that help support our authors and keep the Phandroid servers running.

Ajit is a freelance tech reporter who loves everything tech but has a soft corner for Android. He started his stint in tech journalism in 2015 and has previously worked with publications like Digit India and Android Headlines. You can also find his work on MySmartPrice.
